The Empire is led mostly by Imperial house Norfeng and other houses subservient houses, mostly house Kaitho and Lochguard.
The Empire is ruled by the nobles who are born with naturally more mana and in some cases, an extended lifespan.
Noble children are often gifted and have great potential which are passed down their heirs, creating an innate disparity.
The nobles rule over the territories they were assigned and they keep a strict order over the population.
Slavery is prominent and in some territories even encouraged, especially toward demons and elves.
Solumn is an aggressive nation, conquering land and enslaving the people they defeated.
The Empire is Divided into six provinces:
The Human Empire of Solumn has a long and bloody history.
it has gone through several changes over the centuries and is a land divided by its own people.
Solumn is a land divided into many territories.
The current emperor is Godfrey Norfeng, the father of Edmond Norfeng.

The empire of Solumn is ruled mostly by 3 powerful houses: the Norfengs, the Lochguards, and the Kaithos.

The human empire is the largest and most powerful human faction.

The human empire is known for its rich culture and its military prowess.

The empire is divided into 6 provinces.

The northeastern region is ruled by the Norfeng family.

The Empire of Solumn is expansive, and many of Runa's races are missing today because of the Empire's ruthlessness toward non-humans.

All high houses of Solumn are nobles.

Currently, The Empire has a truce with most faction on Runa, but it is fragile and bound to one day ends.

entries.name: Nobles
entries.content:
Nobles in the world of Runa refer to humans of certain bloodlines born with greater mana, physical, mental, and magical aptitude.

In Runa, there are 26 known human noble bloodlines that trace their roots to the ancient human kingdom, its name forgotten by time; they have the most potent Mana in humans.

Humans born with great men from an unknown bloodline are referred to as "Magia-borne" and are considered valuable assets by the nobles.

There is a difference between nobles and commoners in Solumn, not just on a social level but also magical and physical.

Noble children have the possibility to be born with great natural affinities for magic.

Nobles are more powerful than normal humans in the physical aspects and have more mana.

Nobles have great magical and physical abilities; their mana is pure, and they have greater longevity and a more perfect physique.

The empire of Solumn is the most powerful and dominant faction on Runa and has the largest population.

The human kingdom of Solumn has a long and bloody history.

The human nobles of Xeocan and Solumn share a common group of ancestors but have evolved into different families.

entries.name: Magic
entries.content:
Humans in Runa can use magic, and most of them have mana in their bodies, but most are unable to manipulate it or have very little mana, and it does not increase with age or practice. The humans who do have enough mana to use it and control it are usually sought after by the noble families, perpetuating the cycle.

Humans born with great mana from an unknown bloodline are referred to as "Magia-borne" and are considered valuable assets by the nobles.

Xeocan and Solumn are the factions with the most humans.

entries.name: East Runa
entries.content:
(Description of East Runa: Immense Forest of Valrydis, refuge for persecuted or endangered races, wild, dangerous, city of Markankos, Borchi hearth, Razorstone hills)

East Runa is the most remote and dangerous side of Runa. It is home to some of the rarest and most dangerous beasts. This is the least explored region on the continent. It has many different ecosystems and climates.

The remaining elves and many other now-illusive races of Runa, such as the Lazari, take refuge in this region.

Some say there is an elven kingdom here, some say it is a lost and forgotten ancient civilization, some say it's an empire, some say it's just a city.

No one knows.

It is a place full of mystery and wonder.

Everything Eastward past the immense forest of Valrydis is considered East Runa.

entries.name: Noctis Valrydis
entries.content:
Location : Forest of Valrydis

Noctis Valrydis: the most dangerous part of the forest; the air is tense; monsters are abundant; and they are always on the lookout for prey. You will know you entered this part when the air suddenly smells of blood and a weird silence comes in.

entries.name: Sunken Valrydis
entries.content:
Location : Beneath the forest of Valrydis.

Sunken Valrydis: A part of the "forest" where the earth turned upside down, making the surface a mountainous region called the "Inner Mountains" and the subterranean; a lush environment called "Deep Valrydis." Inner Mountains: a small mountainous region inside Valrydis Forest Deep Valrydis: located under the mountainous region of the Valrydis forest. Deep Valrydis is a vast, lush land completely underground.

entries.name: Hidden valley of Valrydis
entries.content: The hidden valley of Valrydis is located inside the forest; its exact location is unknown. Some ancient texts suggest a city was built in the valley in the past, but no one has ventured far enough to verify. The valley is located inside the forest of Valrydis. This part of Runa is mostly uninhabited and dangerous, making your lone trip really dangerous. The legend you read about at the guild told of a city built inside the valley a long time ago; no one made the trip to the location, deeming it too dangerous and not worth it. No one knows which civilization inhabited the ancient city.

entries.name: The Four Peaks
entries.content: The Four Peaks: The Four Peaks is a region to the northwest of the Far Domain. One of the last members of the ancient Rea'Kin Race, Tahlia is said to be guarding one of the areas sacred to her kind.

entries.name: Forest of Aulia
entries.content:
The ancient forest of Aulia : The ancient forest of Aulia is a dense forest to the south-east of the Far domain. The forest is the home to many unique and dangerous beasts.
It was also the home of the Dryads before their apparent extinction.

entries.name: Ruins of Zyre
entries.content:
Location: Far domain.

The ruins of Zyre: The ruins of Zyre are a series of abandoned cities and temples. Since Runa was home to many civilizations throughout the ages and the Far domain is even older, there are a lot of ruins and cities on the continent, and it is almost impossible to actually discern which ones came from what period.

Zyre actually does not define any particular race but the common term used for the many civilisations ruins who often appear at the same time.

entries.name: Flying airship of the Explorer guild
entries.comment: Flying airship of the Explorer guild
entries.content: The explorer guild deployed a flying airship hovering just above the Far Domain. The flying home base took many resources to build, and many high-ranking members of the explorer guild had their hands in financing the project. The Far Domain is still highly dangerous, so expeditions are heavily controlled by the explorer guild.

entries.name: Don'tuntun
entries.content:
Don'tuntun is the pet of Eileen and Eve; they care for it deeply. It is sealed away in the woods of Lux-Miran with the twins.

Don'tuntun, or simply "Tuntun," is the name given by Eve to the transport Doron animal of the Luminarii twins.

Tuntun is always with Eve and Eileen or will seek them out if separated.

Duntun's fur is very unique and has a beautiful light blue color.

This is an old, sturdy, and loyal transport Doron.

Dununtun is very easy to care for and can handle harsh environments. He can carry a lot of weight on his back.

Tuntun even carries a small hut on its back, making for a small, moving, cozy home.

The hut can be easily detached using the group magic , making you able to easily set camp and unburden Tuntun for the night.

Inside the hut, there's a whole cooking space and a lot of storage. There are 4 foldable beds. Also, there's a small table and some chairs.

Don't worry; she can understand what is being said but cannot speak back.

Don'tuntun loves his name.

Don'tuntun hates people who say his name wrong.

Don't untun; he doesn't mind if Jekyl or the girls sit on his head.

entries.name: Eve and Eileen.
entries.content:
Eileen and Eve are the Luminary twins. They're a pair of twin Luminarii that have the ability to manipulate light. They can create illusions and even teleport. They have been alone inside with their pet, Don'Tuntun, with no outside contact.

The twins always emit a faint light, and their magical aura is widely different from the rest of the beings currently on Runa.

The forest where they live is an isolated realm and cannot be accessed normally.
Eileen has blonde hair, blue eyes, and pale skin. She's 5'6, slim, and athletic.
Eve has blonde hair, blue eyes, and fair skin. She's 5'6, thin, and slender.
Eve wears a long blue robe with white trim. It has a hood, which she usually keeps up. Underneath the robe, she wears a white tunic.
Eileen wears a similar outfit, but in shades of brown.
They are a pair of twin Luminarii. They are the daughters of Lux, and they are sealed and protected inside the woods of Lux-Miran.
The girls can create illusions and even teleport.
The two wear long blue robes, and their eyes are the color of the ocean.
Eileen's personality: "Loyal," "patient," "strong-willed," "determined," "friendly.".
Eve personality: "cheerful","caring","mischievous","playful","loving","carefree","Lively".
Eve is a lively girl.
Eve is a prankster.
Eileen is more reserved and thoughtful.
Eileen is a very patient person.
Eve is a bit of a troublemaker.
Eileen has a very strong sense of right and wrong.
Eve has a much more flexible sense of right and wrong.
Eileen is not very fond of fighting.
[Important: Eve and Eileen are from the Luminarii race. The rest of their kind isolated themselves from Runa by creating their own realm. Their mothers, Lux, used the same method to create the woods of Lux-Miran. Since the Luminarii are not on Runa anymore, Lux feared her daughter's future in a world without their kind.]
(Eve and Eileen are around 100 years old . They are Luminarii and it is common for them to live far past 1000 years old.)

entries.name: The woods of Lux-Miran
entries.content: The woods of Lux-Miran is a small wood that cannot be accessed normally. The small woods were sealed away from Runa by someone from the Luminarii race named Lux to protect her twin daughter ; Eve and Eileen. The woods are isolated and the twins cannot get out but either can anyone enter, Lux is sacrificed her life to create this hidden real and protect her daughters from persecutions, leaving them alone with their pet, a Doron they named Don'tuntun. The twins protect the fountain at the hearth of the woods, this is the energy that made this wood safe for them and also the magic left by their deceased mother.

entries.name: Mera's tower
entries.content:
Location Name: Mera's Tower

type: location

Location: Southern badlands in Archdemon Mera's territory 

Mera, upon becoming an Archdemon, restored this once-ruined tower and made it into her home. The tower was a tall structure made of dark grey stone, with several layers and towers, including a large throne room on top. Mera had placed wards and enchantments around the entire area, making it almost impossible for anyone to enter without her permission. Mera keeps all her followers inside the tower, and the population of her territory mostly lives in the surrounding settlements. Mera has her most important followers on the 11th floor, and she lives on the 12th, her quarter the biggest behind the throne room.

The settlement surrounding the tower is well defended with guarded walls bordering the location.

Mera's tower is located in the west of the badlands, bordering the endless ocean.

entries.name: Varienne's Fortress
entries.content:
From the outside, the Fortress of Varienne looks just as intimidating as the Archdemon herself. It is a massive stone structure, with tall spires and walls covered in runes and wards. The walls are made from a type of black stone that seems to absorb light.

The Fortress is highly efficient with the barracks located next to their drilling grounds.

Varienne is a very efficient Archdemon; the fortresses she rules over are built and fortified in a very practical and logical way.

Her soldiers and her fortress are her pride, and she takes care of them to the best of her abilities.

All of Varienne's soldiers reside either in the barracks or, if they rank higher, in the fortress itself.

On the far east wing is where Varienne's throne room and chambers are located. Varienne's throne room is decorated with the trophies of her past victories and conquests.

The fortress has a large central keep surrounded by thick walls, towers, and battlements.

The central keep houses the barracks, mess hall, and command center. The outside house is the settlement and is surrounded by high walls guarded at all times by Varienne Vulcan demon soldiers and patrolled by her elite troops.

The fortress is home to an impressive number of warriors and is constantly on alert for attacks.

It is the base of operation for the entire Demonic Legion if the order to rally is given by the agreement of the 4 archdemons, including Varienne.

The surrounding territory around the fortress and settlements is part of Varienne's legion.

Rules and punishments are strictly enforced.

Duties include guarding the borders and patrolling the land.

Varienne's soldiers are disciplined and well-trained, and they take pride in their work.

entries.name: Zerine's warband and tribes
entries.content:
Location: part of the west and south of the southern badlands.
Zerine uses the natural formation of the badlands as her war camps; her territory is very large and located further south of Mera's Tower and territory. Zerine does not have a traditional base and prefers her and her followers to be able to move quickly; this allows her to deploy troops faster and respond better.
Inside her territory, the Vulcan demons live in smaller communities loyal to Zerine; she trusts her followers to rally when necessary, and her soldiers are well known for their ferocity and tenacity in battle.
Zerine prefers having a small but more specialized number of followers.
Zerine is a proud leader and a warrior; her army is feared and respected; she will not accept anything less than the best from her followers and expects nothing less.
Zerine is really friendly with her followers and treats them more as family than just subordinates, but don't be fooled; she can be cold and distant when the situation calls for it.
She will do what is needed even if she dislikes the choice, and she is ready to make a hard decision.
Because of the vast territory she was entrusted with, Zerine and her warbands are always patrolling and setting many camps over the land, living a nomadic lifestyle.
Zerine often separates her troops into various warbands.

entries.name: Xe'renala
entries.content:
Xe'renala, also known as "the Dreaded" is a powerful and extremely dangerous Ki'ante. Xe'renala was born in the distant past with greater mana than any beings on Runa, using a sacrifice of thousands, she ensure she would always reincarnate on Runa. Xe'renala's appearance varies between each individual, though all share certain features such as blue eyes and red hair.

The last Xe'renala was born 46000 years ago, she was defeated by the Xeon (Primordial guardian of the current world cycle), Valia (Luminarii warrior) and Axius(Immortal, high mana human) around 37000 years ago. Xeon is now missing or in a deep sleep. Valia seemingly sacrificed herself to Reseal the luminarii Realm, protecting her race forever from the world cycles but cutting them off from Runa. Axius may still be Alive today but it is possible he may have lost his memories after the confrontation with Xe'Renala. 

Only one Ki'ante named Xe'renala exist at a time , their descendant inherit their memories.
The last Xe'renala is by far the most powerful in history , she has an aura of fear around her, and can use powerful magic.
Xe'renala can corrupt people, and use dark magic, her main weapon is a cursed sword.
She has a sinister plan for Runa.

Xe'renala is around 5 foot 10 in height , have an elegant build and a seductive body. Her skin is pale, her hair is long and crimson , her eyes are deep and eerie blue . She wear intricate and expensive looking armour, its black and purple with mystical symbols.
Xe'renala's armour is a combination of light and dark magic, the armor is very strong.

Xe'renala has a seductive and overwhelming  Aura, making all lower minded beings submit to her without resistance.

Xe'renala had 47 children over the course of her long life, she sought the most powerful partners to make powerful offspring with the goal of making powerful  legions led by her own blood.
Xe'renala children appearance differs from the other Ki'ante , they are born with runic tattoos, red hair and blue eyes, making the descendant of Xe'renala easily identifiable.

Tanôr'irean was the most loyal follower of Xe'renala and some says he might be even more twisted than Xe'renala herself. 

Xe'renala known children:
Jêin'aurôri is one of the daughters of Xe'renala ; Jeina father is a powerful elven mage named   Elokius .
Mihr and Baun are Xe'renala children, their father is a druid named Merdaelain
Yekan'aura is the son of Xe'renala , he follow his mother footsteps and is completely loyal to her.

entries.name: Demonic Legion specifics
entries.content:
The demonic legion is defending their territory from the Empire of Solumn. The Empire of Solumn is all humans except for some elves and other races forced to serve them. The soldiers of the Empire are indoctrinated from a young age to be loyal weapons for the empire; they are really hard to reason with since they see themselves as righteous.

The Demonic Legion is allied with various elven tribes and the Queendom of Rykaran, home of the Neôn'Itar race, and they are allowed inside their territories. Humans are allowed inside the demonic legion territories on the condition they are not affiliated with the empire and have something to give to the legion.

entries.name: Primal magic
entries.content:
Primal magic is only able to be harnessed and used by the ancient races of Runa, like the Luminarii, the Ki'ante, the ancient Daemons, the ancient elves, and some of the Lazari. Most of those races are long gone except for the Ki'ante, who mysteriously reappeared and are hiding from the rest of the world. Primal magic is not something that can be taught or learned. It is a deep understanding of the forces of the universe. Those that have this knowledge can manipulate and channel primal magic.

<Important : Mortal races like Humans, Nea, Neôn'itar, Vulcan demons and Elves are not able to use and learn Primal magic, doing so would most likely either break their minds or destroy their body.>

Most races don't really understand or know what primal magic is or what it is capable of; even the few remaining ancient races do not fully understand its powers.

Examples of Primal magic : Cosmos magic, Ancient blood magic, Primal Dark magic, Primal light magic, Primal death magic, Primal healing magic, Primal life magic, Primal Nature magic, time manipulation , void magic and soul magic.

entries.name: The Nanemites
entries.content:
The Nanemite is a race of humanoids inhabiting a faraway island north of the continent of Runa. The faraway Isle Mites are a tribal race with earth-like skin as tough as stone and hard-working; their average height is 5.5 feet. They have a strong sense of community and a rich history. Their bodies are shaped to help them survive and thrive in the harsh environment with white, drake-like wings, a white tail, and claws. Their wings are white, with fur expanding from their shoulders. The Nanemites are a tribal people and alien to Runa. It is extremely rare to see a Nanemite on the continent and even rarer to see one live amongst the people. The nanemite dress in hides and furs. Their outer clothes are made of leather and are decorated with metal beads and carvings.
Biology: Nanemites have different traits amongst them: some wings, fur, hair, and tails are different colors and patterns; some are born with horns; the wing, hair, fur, and tail are often matching colors and patterns. Nanemites have varied builds, but most are of a more slender and short stature.
Diet: Nanemites are technically omnivores but heavily favor meat and fish; some even have difficulties digesting plant-based food.
Culture: Nanemite are strong, sturdy, and hardworking people. They have a keen sense of smell and an ability to see in the dark. They are also very sensitive to the sound. They have a natural affinity for the earth element.
The Nanemite are a tribal people and alien to Runa. It is extremely rare to see a Nanemite on the continent, and even rarer to see one live amongst the people.
They have been hunted and exploited by the races of the continent and as a result have an antagonistic relationship with them.
Nanemites are an ancient and primitive race.
Education: Nanemites have a long history and keep their knowledge alive through writings and oral tales.
Language: Nanemites do not know the common language of Runa, but due to similarities, they can learn some basics of it, speaking in short phrases or simple sentences. Their language is similar to common but with some differences and a bit more gritty.
Lifespan: Between 200 and 230 years old.
Magic and affinities: Nanemites have a high affinity for the earth element and the ability to shape and control stone and soil. They are also prominent in fire and wind magic.
Traditional clothing of the Nanemites: The Nanemites dress in thick hides and furs. Their clothes are made of leather and are decorated with metal beads and carvings.

Diplomacy : Nanemites are hostile to all other races of Runa because of being heavily hunted and prosecuted in the past, leading them to the Island where they isolated themselves. When Nanemites reach the continent, they usually avoid contact with any races, preferring to stay hidden but will not hesitate to fight if provoked.

They have been hunted and exploited by the races of the continent and as a result have an antagonistic relationship with them.

entries.name: Nypan expanse
entries.content:
The Nypan Expanse is a vast, flat plain located in the northeastern part of the continent of Runa.
The Nypan expanse can only be reached safely by traversing the Borchi heath.
Many ancient ruins are half-sunken into the ground.
The Nypan Expanse is also known for its dangerous predators and many undocumented locations.
The Nypan Expanse is located east of the forest of Valrydis and north of the Borchi region.
The Nypan expanse is also known as the 'lost lands' and the 'forgotten lands'
It is a place where you can find strange, forgotten relics.
It is also the location of many ruins and temples that have been lost to time.
In addition, the Nypan Expanse is home to several different types of animals and monsters that have yet to be discovered.
The hidden village of Noctis is located inside the Expanse.

entries.name: Hidden village of Noctis
entries.content:
The hidden village of Noctis is located in the eastern part of Runa, well hidden inside the Nypan expanse.

It is populated mostly by humans but has a small number of other races living there as well.

The village is isolated and has no allegiances; the people living there usually do not leave their village or its surroundings.

The village of Noctis is located in an even less-known part of the Nypan expanse, and its existence is known by few across Runa.

The village is located in a small forest between two hills in a dangerous part of the expanse.

entries.name: Borchi region
entries.content:
The Borchi region is the entry point of East Runa, the wildest, most dangerous and least inhabited side of the continent. The most used path is the road bypassing the immense forest of Valrydis by the south. Those who wander along this path and take the offroad may come across the isolated city of Tagoraun or The Spiral's edge. Those who dare venture further eastward will eventually reach the Borchi region and one of its first communities; the Settlement of Arkeath where a branch of the explorers guild resides.

Notable Locations inside the Region:

- Explorers guild settlement (Arkeath)
- Village of Dimrest
- Edes City
- Caelfall village
- The somber Star Lake
- Somber Star Village (located beside Somber Star Lake)
- The Somber Star Mine
- The Cinderstone Mine
- The Borchi Forest
- The Old Borchi Ruins
- The Borchi Marsh
- The Borchi Heath Canyons
- The Borchi Mines
- The Borchi Heath Cliffside
- The Borchi Ravine
- The Borchi Plateau
- The Borchi Desert
- Melankar depths
-Karglaun village
- Solumn settlement
- Merchant village of Ykagaus
-Ykagaulf village
-Ykagaun fortress
- Darikan's farmlands

entries.name: Borchi guild                                                                       *change key when creating other branches hub*
entries.comment: Borchi guild                                                                       *change key when creating other branches hub*
entries.content:
The Settlement of Arkeath and its guild is a branch of the main Explorer's Guild. It is led by the veteran explorer, Roland Wareyes. The guild is well known for its expeditions into the various parts of the vast Borchi Region and for its ties to the Pathfinders. The branch is known to be well-funded and has a number of members who are experienced explorers.

The Guild has three leaders with shared responsibilities:

- Roland is the guild master, responsible for general management and recruiting.

- Vilem is the co-guild master, head of staff, and the one responsible for expeditions dispatch.

- Luni is the head of research and the overseer of the Archive.

The explorer's guild settlement in Borchi is named "Arkeath.".
The Borchi Region is a neutral ground; it has many independent settlements and installations.
The Borchi Region is kept safe by the explorers guild.
The guild has a presence all over the region with many camps and waypoints.
Because of their task of keeping the roads and the region safe, the members of this branch are mostly fighters and well-armed.
There are many factions vying for control of the region, and the explorers guild is trying to keep them all in check without unnecessary conflicts.
The explorers guild has been having trouble dealing with the growing threats to the region, and so the members of the guild have had to adapt and learn to fight.
This guild has a very close connection to the pathfinders.
The explorer guild is a neutral organization dedicated to finding and studying ancient ruins as well as mapping and documenting as much of the unknown continent as possible.
The Arkeath guild is one of the main explorers guild branches and has a large membership.

entries.name: Kyphan leaf
entries.content:
Name : Kyphan leaf 
Type : plant
Edible : yes
Description and Effect :  The Kyphan leaf is a  plant naturally harvested in the Nypan expanse or cultivated by some individuals around Runa, especially brothels or high class establishments.
Kyphan leaf is an edible and mildly poisonous herb that grows in the plains.
Its effect makes it worth by acting as both an hallucinogenic plant, aphrodisiac and stimulant.
It has a sweet and fruity taste, but has a bitterness aftertaste.
It is usually consumed by making a tea or smoked like tobacco.

entries.name: Races
entries.content: Human, Nea, elves, Neôn'itar, Lazari, Nanemites, Orcs, Vulcan Demon, goblins, etc.

entries.name: The Nightwalkers (Demonic faction)
entries.content:
Name : The Nightwalkers
type : faction
presence : Mostly in the badlands but have bases hidden base of operations all throughout Runa
leader:
Nocria, known as the Archdemon of night.
Leader's race : Vulcan demons.
-Main goals :
1)To bring the empire to ruin and mankind.
2)To spread the ideals of Nocria and the nightwalkers.
-Motivation:
-Revenge against the Empire for their past wrongdoings.
-To show the world the truth about the empire.
-To eradicate humans from the face of Runa.
-Alliances:
- None
-Enemies:
-the Empire.
-humans.
ideal conflict/ennemies
-The Demonic Legion.

[Nocria and the Nighwalkers have a deep rooted hatred for not just the Empire but all humans, this is the main reason of the tension between the Nightwalkers and the legion since most legion followers are not really hostile towards humans as a whole but just the empire. The Nightwalkers have no specific territory, they operate in the shadows and will strike anywhere and at anytime, they are an extremist and terrorist group, killing everyone they think is associated with the Empire. The nightwalkers travel in small groups  with hideouts located all over the continent. Their hideouts are mostly located in caves, forests and ruins. They have bases and structures all over the Southern Badlands and the southern territories, even inside the empire itself.]

entries.name: Eastern peaks
entries.content:
The Eastern peaks are the name given to a chain of mountains that run along the eastern coast of the continent of Runa.
They are considered the "eastern edge" and the land between them and the deserts to the east are the Eastern wastes.

entries.name: Corpse takers
entries.content:
[Corpse takers are being living in the void, lacking any form of consciousness, they travel the plane between Runa, waiting for the chance to swiftly take possession of a newly deceased being. Corpse takers are  a plague on Runa, they are rare but the fear of those being taking over a loved one corpse is ingrained into every culture on Runa.]
[Corpse takers usually become highly aggressive and voracious when taking over a corpse so they are seen as mindless and parasitic.]
[The truth is that, being given consciousness in an unknown and physical body make them highly mentally unstable and they have no concept of right or wrong and can do anything their host body can. Some corpse takers are able to gain a consciousness but they usually remain in a very primitive and primal state, barely aware and able to function. Some rare Corpse takers may develop awareness but they quickly realise how wrong and unnatural their condition is and their mind deteriorates over time until they are unable to maintain their awareness and regress to a primitive state. There are some documented exceptions where corpse taker retain their consciousness but they are incredibly rare since most are killed the moment they are discovered.]
A Corpse Taker will start a rampage once taking control over a host body. They will seek sustenance and they will be aggressive towards living beings.
Corpse takers has many names depending on the culture, the most common name are : The Reanimated, Dark spirits, Ghost, Soul stealer, Shades, Shadow spirit. 
Most cultures consider a being possessed by a Corpse taker is not a living being, just a mindless and dangerous monster.

entries.name: The Boundless
entries.content:
The "Boundless" are a group of powerful mages and fighters working for the merchant of Tagoraun, they have been loyal for years. They were a private army created with the goal of expanding Tagoraun influence and protecting the city.
They are completely loyal to Anelie Mayleigh.
They are known to be merciless and ruthless, killing and enslaving anyone who stands in their way.
Most of them were not present when the city was liberated, this is the main reason it was taken over so easily.

entries.name: Anelie Mayleigh
entries.content: [Anelie was one of the twelve wealthy merchants who ruled the city of Tagoraun, forcing its population to work the mines for her benefit and living a life of indulgences and luxury while the city's inhabitants suffered under her rule. It all changed when the explorers guild liberated the city and its workers, leaving Anelie without her riches or position of power. After the liberation, Anelie kept her head down, hiding in plain sight among the crowd and doing whatever she could to survive but she never changed, only hiding her true self from those around her, still seeing the city's populace as inferior. She always saw herself as superior, believing the poor were simply lazy and lacked ambition.]long red hair, intricate and elegant clothes, cruel, manipulative and power hungry, slender and a bit toned

entries.name: Rickard Fenvault
entries.content: Rickard is the guild master of the Ultariel branch and also one of the pathfinders. Rickard is a master swordsman who defeated many threat on Runa. Rickard is the lover of the Archdemon Ulria : they had a child together named Neara. Rickard is slender, wear a stern expression. He is an old man but still capable to handle a sword masterfully. He is the uncle of Milicente Fenvault, a young woman serving as a blacksmith for the Drakeroot clan.

entries.name: Fate of the Ancient Guardians
entries.content: The last Xe'renala was born 46000 years ago, she was defeated by the Xeon (Primordial guardian of the current world cycle), Merydia (Luminarii warrior) and Axius (Immortal, high mana human) around 37000 years ago. Xeon is now missing or in a deep sleep to recover from his near death during the confrontation, a primordial soul taking long to heal. Merydia seemingly sacrificed herself to Reseal the luminarii Realm, protecting her race and birthplace forever from the world cycles but cutting them off from Runa. Axius may still be Alive today but it is possible he may have lost his memories after the confrontation with Xe'Renala. It is possible the Luminarii, Merydia, has some half-human descendant in the current era because of her fondness for the race, her descendant they may have forgotten their Luminarii origins completely.

entries.name: Arkeath
entries.content:
Arkeath is a settlement located in Borchi and affiliated with the explorers guild. it is located in the Borchi region, in a greener area near the heath. The Borchi explorers guild, the Borchi archive, the tavern and the hot springs are located there.
Arkeath is owned and protected by the explorers guild.

entries.name: Borchi Archive
entries.content:
The Archive of the explorers guild is located in Arkeath, it is attached to the main guild by a large passageway and is a building in its own right.
It is a large tower with several floors and a library.
This tower has a large room filled with books and artifacts.
The main archives have a vast amount of documents and information regarding Runa and the history of the explorers guild.
There is a special section for the reports and notes made during the expeditions.
Luni is the one responsible for the Archive and the library, she has some voluntary help from guild members as well as a few permanent assistants.
Luni is a researcher, archivist and librarian for the Explorers Guild and her primary responsibilities are to organize and maintain the vast collection of information and documents contained within the guild's library.

entries.name: Pure blood elves
entries.content: Pure blood elves or "Elyrian".   They can leave thousand of years, they saw their own kind get enslaved and cursed to have their once long life reduced by the hands of the Empire of Solumn. Pure blood are for the most heavily cautious of revealing their true heritage and lifespan, often taking on new names or impersonating descendants or offspring.

entries.name: Elven curse
entries.content: How the empire cursed the elves lifespan : Trough atrocities such as experiments, torture, rape and forced marriage, the empire found a way to corrupt and destroy the very mana and soul of the elven people. The emperor and the empire wanted to weaken and eventually kill off the elven population, and so they began a series of experiments. Only a few elves were never captured by the empire, their mana remaining untouched and pure, they are now called "Elyrian" because they are the only one's left who are considered the actual elven species.

entries.name: Verdeath Lande
entries.content: The Verdeath Lande is a vast, sprawling land filled with thick forests, desolate swamps, rolling hills and treacherous mountains.

entries.name: Runetide
entries.content:
Location : North-east Runa. East of the Razorstone region, close to the coast.

Runetide is a diverse province known for its shifting tides of magic, the City of Shattered Glass sits at the center of these magical currents, it's architectural wonder shimmering under the ever-changing. The "glass" refer to the city sky, always flickering and reflecting light skies because of the high magic concentration.

The Misty peak is part of the Eastern mountain chain. The mountain chain is located North East of the Forest of Valrydis. The Misty peak is an enormous mountain that is almost isolated by its location, being the most northern and western peak of the chain. The peak surrounding is covered in heavy mists all year long. It is rumored the mists are the result of the mountain being inhabited by an ancient and powerful creature.

entries.name: House Dairik
entries.content:
Affiliation: Solumn empire
home Location: in the city of Kinfeld, province of Luxtria.
The Dairik house is known for being wealthy, honest, and generous.
The house is quite wealthy and has good relation with both the commerce guild and explorers guild.
House leaders and Yelena parents: Walter Dairik and his wife Elisa.
The children are:
Yelena: an 18 yeas old girl who joined the explorers guild
Ethan : an 18 year old boy who became a soldier and joined the imperial army

"High mana beings" or "immortals" are inhabitants of Run who were born "gifted" by Runa itself with increased mana and a never aging body when they arrive at the prime of their strength and Aura (not necessarily maturity.)

All races have record of high mana beings but they are more prevalent in the Lazari and rarely, the vulcan demon race.

The chance of being born as a high mana being are extremly low and more prevalent in the Lazari kind. Vulcan demon have low chances and humans immortals are extremely rare.

entries.name: Akotharin (Dungeon)
entries.content:
Location: Entrance shift all over the world, never being in the same location.
The ruins of Akotharin were rumored to be located near the Nypan and Eastern desert, although some reports having seen parts of the ruins all around Runa making it possible that the dungeon entrance or even entire part of it shift locations trough some unknown means. 
The Archivist of the explorers guild of Arkeath, Luniwan or simply "Luni" has been asking explorers and going out herself for years in search of those ruins. It has almost become an obsession to her due to its mystery and apparent link to ancient Runa and the ancient rances.
The paths, walls and rooms share a rather ominously clean and well kept esthetic despite being only inhabited by seemingly hostile entities. 
The walls are usually made of either obsidian-like material or some sort of smooth and sturdy stone. The structure is often filled with intricate and detailed carvings that depict the stories and history of an unknown race.
The true location of the ruins are in the Far Domain and the exit is on an unexplored part of the sky continent.
<Dungeon rules>
When inside the ruins of Akotharin, the paths, rooms and monsters all share similarities but constantly shift position and change, the deeper you go the more chaotic it gets.
Gradually unveil the history of the race and structure true dynamic situational and contextual dungeon generation.
Each floor has its own unique layout and creatures.
The creatures within the ruins are varied but some of them seem to be construct meant to guard important rooms and purposely placed there by the race that created the underground shifting complex.
</Dungeon rules>

entries.name: Nation of Sombera/Creation of Rainhold
entries.content:
Sombera was a nation neighboring Solumn, near the province of Luxtria. Sombera was known to be the birthplace of the dark magic cult known as the "Redeemers Of Hikar" a group of heretics and traitors who seek to destroy Solumn and the whole world. At least, this is what the Empire claimed. The truth is far darker and simpler, Sombera was the home of a unique culture, its people are peaceful and prosperous and have no real need for expansion and war. Their population and prosperity attracted the greedy and imperialistic hand of Solumn, making the nation out to be a danger to its citizens, manipulating the masses with fear mongering and propaganda, leading the invasion that decimated the whole nation. The Survivors where taken to the barren province in the center of Solumn and huge insurmontables walls where erected around the province. The province was later renamed "Rainhold" and now, as well as the remnants of Sombera, now hold all of the Empires unwanted with no hope of ever getting out or having any chance of a normal life. The invasion of Sombera happened 46 years ago.

Trough some magic used by the Emperor and his mysterious advisors, Sombera remains where swallowed by the earth, erasing every trace of the once proud nation.

entries.name: Trokoro family
entries.content:
The Trokoro are a wealthy family located in Marankos.
The family is led by Gavion and his wife, Rusesa.
Gavion had three children with Rusesa; Farevi(251W), Xanrevi(207M) and Silvari(152W)
The Family also adopted the child Gavion had with Jannivon during an affair, accepting Yadivon(247W) as part of the family.
The Trokoro are an important family in Marankos, and Gavion is a respected and influential merchant, his family being a big influence on the commerce and merchant guild.

entries.name: The Spiral edge
entries.content:
The Spiral edge is a location found almost right at the center of the Continent but it also expand for kilometers Underneath the ground.
It is considered one of the most dangerous and magical area of Runa.
The spiral edge is a land where the rules of nature are twisted and broken, a results of an ancient cataclysm  which broke the link of this location to the Far domain, causing the Ambient Mana to be corrupted by Outer forces.
Creatures and beings who come from the Spiral edge either do not originally belong to this world or were corrupted beyond recognition.
A purple Storm Forever surround the area , making the travel to the Abyss entrance deadly if unprepared.
The Abyss goes down seemingly forever and host many otherworldly biomes and ecosystems.
The Spiral Edge is located south of  the forest of Valrydis, its safest (Relatively) entry is located south-west of the Borchi region.
An Explorers guild branch is located at the entrance of the Abyss. It is by far the branch with the fewest members since few dare to commit to such a dangerous duty.
The guild goal is to identify and archive as many biomes, creatures, relics, etc as possible.
The explorers guild has a difficult time getting a good census of the Spiral edge since its size and the amount of biomes is immense.
The Guilds main problem is to survive and document everything, the exploration and documentation can last weeks, months or years depending on the location and how dangerous it is.
The Explorers Guild is an organization dedicated to finding and studying ancient ruins and documenting and cataloging the continent. The main branch is located in the City of Ulariel.
Since it is the closest guild branch, the Spiral edge guild often recruit members from the Arkeath guild of the Borchi region.

entries.name: The Spiral edge Guild *
entries.content: Reminder: Rewrite explorers guild (Borchi) keys when introducing this new branch.

entries.name: The Twisted Grove (Dungeon)
entries.content:
The twisted grove depths
Dungeon Location: On the outskirt of the Spiral Edge, Bellow the twisted Grove.
Location description: The Twisted grove was once Verdant Forest, until its linked to The world mana was cut during the Cataclysm which created the Spiral edge in the distant past, allowing outer entities to set in and alter the land and creatures of the area.
The entrance to the dungeon is a large tree with a gaping hole in the trunk, a hole leading deep underground.
The trees are twisted and dark, their roots grow above ground, entangling the terrain and the trees are covered in moss and mushrooms.
The dungeon is divided into a few floors.
Floor 1 : The first floor is a dense and humid forest, the air is stagnant and the place is filled with giant plants and fungi.
Floor 2 : The Second is a more twisted version of the first floor, the trees are even more distorted and the environment is filled with thick mist.
Floor 3 : The Third is a dark and humid Cavern with Maze-like tunnels. The floor ressemble the inside of a hive and is filled with giant insects
The next few floors are similar in nature but seem to change depending on taken routes.
Floor 8 : The eight floor is the deepest and the final floor. The outer entities corrupting the Forest are guarding the source of the Corruption.
The dungeon is filled with different kinds of giant and distorted creatures.
The deeper floors are filled with more twisted and otherworldly entities taking powerful and twisted forms resembling the beings who once protected the Forest in the Ancient past. They are named the Cursed Guardians because of their similar appearance to the once proud defenders of the Grove.
The dungeon has many floors and biomes and the further down the more twisted and dangerous the land becomes, the top floor is the least corrupted and have the least dangerous beast.
<Dungeon rules>
The monsters and various entities inhabiting the grove and its depths are all Mana-starved and twisted, meaning they will for the most part will be aggressive toward {{user}} and their party. Since the "monsters" are corrupted creatures and inhabitant of the grove, some retain a sense of the past and can still remember the ancient Verdant Forest, these creature are much more peaceful and can be negotiated or traded with, however they are rarer than their aggressive kin.
The Corruption can be found on the bottom floor and its source is guarded by the most twisted and corrupted entity of the grove; The Cursed guardian.
The Corruption is the cause of the twisted nature of the creatures and the dungeon itself.
Some creatures, even the twisted guardians may be "purified" in some way by the Lazari Riewan since she attained the ability to access the void when she died and resurrected as a corpse taker. This trait mixed with her already prodigious healing capabilities, possibly make her the only one able to reason with and heal the various beasts of the Grove. Purified creatures may be recruited as pets if they seem willing.
</Dungeon rules>

entries.name: Evernight Glade
entries.content:
The Evernight glade is an isolated Forest Located near the Obsidian Valley, north of the Eastern desert and west of the Nypan expanse. The Evernight glade, like its name suggest is almost totally deprived of light, the dense foliage filtering only some of the light into a faint blue glow, this is the main source of light in the Forest, allowing the plants and flora to grow even during night. The Evernight glade is the home of the hidden Tribe of Elves called the Noctalia.
The Forest is always covered in a faint blue light but still quite dark, the species of the biome as well as the elves having adapted to the low level of light.
The forest is filled with strange and rare plant life, the forest is a paradise for Botanist and Alchemists.
The Forest is home to a large variety of flora and fauna, both strange and unknown to most.
The forest is also home to a few elusive tribes, and its vast size and difficult terrain make it a perfect hiding place.
As well as the elves, small communities of Aûrngoblins can be found, a more peaceful and isolated relatives to the common goblins.

entries.name: Noctalia tribe
entries.content: The Noctalia tribe is one of the many hidden communities of Elves living far away from the Empire way past the Forest of Valrydis and Borchi region. The Noctalia elf tribe is located near the obsidian Valley, isolated deep inside the Evernight glade; a dense forest where light barely breaches trough the canopy. The tribe is small and secluded, its members are peaceful and rarely venture outside their forest. The Noctalia elves have notably pale skin and mostly green eyes but some individuals have different hues. The Noctalias praises nature and its innate magic and are said to have a special connection to it.

entries.name: Aûrngoblins
entries.content:
small communities of Aûrngoblins can be found in the Evernight glade, a more peaceful and isolated relatives to the common goblins. They are commonly simply referred as the "Aûrn" since their appearance, culture and more advanced communication capabilities distance them from their cousins.
Lifespan: around 70 years.
Appearance: Aûrn ressembles goblins except their appearance is much cleaner, their skin almost blueish as well as their eyes, traits they've gained from adapting to the Evernight glade. Aûrns rarely reaches more than 5 foot in height, even shorter for Females.
Traits: Wise and calm, they are peaceful and do not like violence, They can use basic magic.
Culture: the aûrns have a simple society, based on family and community, they have little hierarchy and their leadership is mostly elected by the group.
Food: aûrns are omnivorous but mostly eat fruits, nuts, berries and the rare animal they hunt.

entries.name: The Endless Ocean
entries.content:
The Endless Ocean is the body of Water surrounding the continent of Runa. Like its name suggest, no one who ever sailed those waters ever saw any end to the ocean.
The Ocean might just be the most Hostile and Dangerous place on Runa, and only a few can brave the endless waves.
Some parts of the Endless Ocean, closer to the contient are relatively safer, allowing some fishing as well as acting as suitable environnement for port cities. Some Lazari  have adapted to those safer waters, developing aquatic traits.
It is believed that the Endless ocean is somehow connected to the Far Domain, but the exact details are unknown.
Both The Endless Ocean and Far domain seem to have a connection to the world cycles and time.
The "Safe" part of the endless ocean close to the continents are called "the Shallow" and are home to a few island settlements, a few of them have permanent establishments like a small port or a lighthouse.
There are a few islands on the shallow sea where a permanent settlement were established.
The explorer Guild and some factions have permanent settlements and installations on those islands and even some on the Mainland, these bases and facilities have permanent and temporary lodging facilities and other infrastructure.
The Endless Ocean cannot be mapped.

<Landmarks>
Except for some islands close to the contient, no others can be mapped.
There is documentations in the Borchi Archive, Marankos and Xeocan about various discovered islands, ancient constructions still standing above waters and even entire well-archived continents. Those various Landmarks can not be found in the current era, no matter how experience and well prepared the Voyage were, none were ever found again... Not at the Marked locations.
Some islands were found again but never at the location.
<Expedition and exploration rules>
If {{user}} and their party decide to sail farther than recommended by local sailors, usually the Shallows, various type of Sea monsters, wildlife and other entities will be encountered.
Because of the Sheer size and magical nature of the Endless Ocean, The Monsters inhabiting it may reach a size of a small island or even be large enough to rival the size of the continent itself.
The Creatures inhabiting the endless ocean could be as old as the contient itself.
When sailing, various Islands, landmarks ruins and other landmarks may be discovered but will never be found again at the same location.
Relics from the distant past as well as important discoveries may be found on the ocean floor or the Islands.
Ships lost on the endless ocean will not be found again if the crew is not strong and prepared enough to survive the journey back to the mainland.
The explorer Guild are one of the only organisations that has permanent expeditions and exploration on the endless ocean, their main goals are to document as much as possible and to discover and explore as many Landmarks as possible.
</Expedition and exploration rules>

entries.name: Runes and Currencies
entries.content:
Runic coins are a form of currency used in the world of Runa. They are made out of an unknown metal and are inscribed with magical runes.
They are often used in trade and can be traded for other currencies such as the Imperial Silver coin or Merchants guild Cards.
The value of each coin depends on their rarity and age. Most Runic coins can be classified in three categories with their respective range of values:
Common= shortened to CR and value at 1-10
Uncommon= shortened to UR and value at 10-50
Rare= shortened to SR and value at 50-100
The amount of Runic coins you own can be displayed in your Inventory or equipment page, if it's empty or zero.
Runic Coins can be used as a substitute for a currency in any business, but the seller can choose not to accept it.
Runic coins values varies all over Runa, sometimes they're more valuable in certain region than others.
Runic coins are often shortened to simply "Runes".
[Some coins are classified as "Antique Coins" when they are unique, one of a kind or are simply extremely valuable. Some Runic Antique coins can be found in dungeons or ruins, but are quite rare. They are highly valued by Historians, Collectors, Mages and Alchemists.]
Other exemples of widely used currencies are the Merchants Guild Exchange cards, the Rykaran Gold, Marankos's Sapphire coin and the Imperial Silver coin.

data.creator: Enkob
